definition: to pierce through/to pass through/to be stringed together/string of 1000 cash

to string together/to skewer/to connect wrongly/to gang up/to rove/string/bunch/skewer/classifier for things that are strung together, or in a bunch, or in a row: string of, bunch of, series of/to make a swift or abrupt linear movement (like a bead on an abacus)/to move across

sentences.english: The principle of people's democracy runs through the whole constitution.
sentences.chinese: 人民民主的原则贯串在我们整个宪法中。

sentences.english: Competition of standards runs through the whole developing process of information industry.
sentences.chinese: 标准竞争贯串于信息产业发展的整个过程。

sentences.english: Take the people as this thought penetration in which, and becomes its core.
sentences.chinese: 以民为本思想贯串其中，并成为其核心。

sentences.english: "Northern History" runs through them and give them a book, really not easy.
sentences.chinese: 《北史》要把它们贯串于一书，确实不容易。

definition: variant of 連貫|连贯[lian2 guan4]
to run through/a connecting thread from beginning to end/to link
to link up/to join together/to connect
to link up (disparate elements)/coherent (narrative, argument etc)
(feng shui) beneficial influence, esp. from one's ancestral graves/to confer a beneficial influence
to constrict/to draw tight/to gather (one's thoughts)/to bring to a close/to pack (for a journey)
variant of 連綴|连缀[lian2 zhui4]
arteries and veins/network of blood vessels/vascular system (of a plant or animal)/(fig.) fabric (i.e. underlying structure, as in "social fabric")/overall context
